intro: Trichomanes fargesii, commonly known as the Farges' clubmoss, is a rare and endangered vascular plant belonging to the family Huperfamily. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and sporangia that are clustered in strobila, typical of the order Lepidoziellales. Native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China, it thrives in cool, moist, and shaded environments. The plant is valued for its medicinal properties and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to habitat destruction and over-collection, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
